meaning_mnemonic: This looks like a <radical>hook</radical>, like the kind a pirate would wear. The flat line shows where the hand was cut off, and the hook is right above, ready to take its place. Yarrrr.

This is the <radical>snake</radical> radical. See the head at the top with its long skinny body stretching down from it?

Don't confuse this with 己 (oneself) — the snake has an extra line behind its head to connect to the rest of its body.

This is the radical for <radical>cloud</radical>. See how the cloud is puffy on the bottom but has two lines up top? That's because a plane flew through it.

It was a nice cloud to hang out privately in, until that darn plane came through and ruined it. So much for your private cloud!

Stick a table on top of a stool and you end up with a very dangerous <radical>weapon</radical>. Imagine hitting someone with this thing! Or, even better, imagine making someone sit on it. They'd be crushed mentally and emotionally and whatnot. Now that's a scary weapon.

This radical is made up of two slightly different versions of the spoon radical. Look closely at these two spoons. <radical>Compare</radical> their differences, like the different angles in the bends of the spoons. It's like one of those "spot the difference" games where you compare two similar pictures. But this time it's with spoons.
This is a <radical>net</radical>, spread out over the water. Imagine all the fish you can catch in this net!

Most of this radical is just the rice radical, but the top part is something coming to cut the rice from its stalk. That, my friend, is the <radical>sickle</radical>. See how the rice is still there? That's because it's in motion. The sickle is literally doing the cutting RIGHT NOW! (And don't confuse this with the grain 禾 radical!)

This radical looks like a <radical>horse</radical>. See the long, thick neck with the mane flowing to the right? What might look like a wing is actually the horse's four legs and its tail hanging down.

Don't confuse this radical with the bird radical (鳥). They look similar, but this one doesn't have the little feather sticking out of the top of its head!
Flying to the sun with wings is <radical>easy</radical>! Or so Icarus thinks. Someone should probably tell him…

You find a coffin on the sun. It's burnt to a crisp from the heat, but there's definitely someone in there. You wonder who this mysterious someone might have been. Whoever they were, they got a fancy sun burial, so they really must've been someone (or shall we say, sun-one?).

This is the radical for <radical>suit</radical>, like when something suits you. You find a hat on the ground, and when you pick it up, there's a mouth underneath. "It suits you! It suits you!" the mouth says. You try the hat on, and yup — it really suits! It's weird getting fashion advice from a random mouth, but hey, it wasn't wrong.

This radical is a <radical>cage</radical> because it's covered on all sides but one (the one open side is where the cage door or gate is). There's nothing inside this cage because there's no gate, and whatever was inside has gotten out. I hope it wasn't rabid...

This looks like the kind of building you'd find in a Japanese <radical>capital</radical>. See the ornate roof and the stone foundation flaring out underneath, like a castle? The emperor lives in there. And wherever the emperor lives automatically becomes the capital city. That's why this radical is capital.

Alternatively, you can use the radical parts and imagine a giant lid on the pot that will feed the mouths of all the small people in the capital.

This is a <radical>cape</radical>, like the kind a superhero would wear. Use your imagination to picture a hero facing left, with a cape tied around their neck and hanging down their back. With that cape on, they're ready to save the world!
